chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court with attorney Thomas a Starr.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel rec'd PSI, no corrections.  State negotiated with Atty Starr and recommends 3 yrs 6 mos. probation with conditions: 90 days in the PCJ; no possession or use of controlled substance; no possession or use of alcohol.  Atty Starr recommends defendant be placed on probation with condition AODA & follow through with recom.; no consumption or possess. of illicit drugs; pay court costs.  Court sentences defendant to 3 1/2 yrs. WI State Prison system, 1 1/2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES; eligible for Substance Abuse Program; conditions of ES:  Provide DNA sample; pay court costs; other conditions requested by P&P.  Advised of felony prohibitions; appeal rights.
DOC request for extension to complete PSI approved.  No change in sentencing date.
Sentencing hearing at 04-25-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court with attorney Thomas a Starr.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1, other counts will be DRI.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1/max penalties, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WRF filed.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Dismiss DRI counts 2-6, Order PSI.  Bond addressed and ordered remain as previously set.  Defendant currently in custody, not on these charges.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  February 1, 2016 at 3:45 p.m.
Status conference at 02-01-2016 03:45 pm

Attorney Thomas a Starr in court.  Defendant f/t/a. Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant currently in different county jail.  Reschedule.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference at 01-25-2016 10:15 am
Status conference at 01-04-2016 01:15 pm

Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court with attorney Thomas a Starr.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Starr has not received the Information.  DA provides Information to Atty Starr.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, advises defendant of constitutional rights, and felony prohibitions.  Atty Starr enters NGP entered on all counts, request jury trial.  DA to check into count 2.  Any motions to be filed within 30 days.  If motions filed, schedule MH at that time.  Referred to scheduling clerk for FPT & JT, mandatory appearances by all parties. Any conditions of bond previously set are continued.  Defendant to report to the PCJ for fingerprints.
Refund $2000 of $2500 cash bond as ordered.
Arraignment at 10-20-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court with attorney Thomas a Starr.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg., WPH form filed with the court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA file Informations with the court.  Atty Starr requests separate Arraignment date and requests to address bond.  Mr. Weiss' employer posted the bond, paying employer from wages.  Court asks defendant questions, where he lives, Washington St. in Durand where he rents; working for tree service past 3 mos.  Court inquires of any open cases: Eau Claire & Dunn Co.; How much defendant still owes his employer of his bond: $2000.  Court inquires if State has any objection to reduce bond to $500.  State notes defendant has open & pending felony cases.  State unaware of bond conditions in other cases.  Defendant informs the court they are Signature Bonds.  Court reduces bond to $500 cash & release bond to person who posted it but that person remains as surety.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Discovery Demand
Atty Thomas Starr appt'd.
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 01:00 pm
S.R. is required to appear on 08/31/2015 at 1:00 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters informs the court defendant qualifies for SPD, Atty Rivard will be appointed.  Request to modify bond to signature.  State objects to bond modification, lengthy criminal history, pending cases in Dunn County and Eau Claire County.  Cash bond necessary to protect the public.  Court orders bond remain as set.  These offenses occurred while defendant was on bond in pending felony cases.  Atty Waters requests P.H., waives time limits, defendant agrees.  Court refers counsel to scheduling clerk for P.H. @ 9/1/15.

Comply with all other bond conditions in any other active cases; 
No violations of law.

Defendant Ryan J. Weiss in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint.  Defendant advised of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Defendant was out on bond from Eau Claire & Dunn Co. when this occurred; has prior convictions of D.C. in 2002; Battery in 2003; OWI 2nd in 2005; Resisting in 2014 along with pending cases in Eau Claire & Dunn Co.  Defendant requests court reconsider bond.  Court notes Signature Bond not an option for reasons stated on record.  Court sets $2500 cash bond with conditions:  comply with all other bond conditions in any other active case; no violations of law.  Court continues INIT to next Tues. @ 3 p.m. and encourages defendant to contact the SPD office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Officer's Return and Inventory of Property Found.  Search Warrant Signed by Judge James Duvall on 08-11-2015.  Application for Search Warrant by Chief Stanley Ridgeway.
